article.headline: Loyola of Chicago 73, Wis.-Milwaukee 68
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- Forward Leon Young had 21 points and 14 rebounds as Loyola of Chicago beat Wisconsin-Milwaukee 73-68 in overtime Saturday night. Loyola (3-5, 1-1) took a 38-27 lead early in the second half, but the Panthers fought back, taking a 46-45 lead when Ricky Franklin converted a 3-point play with 4:36 left. The Panthers (3-6, 0-2) expanded the lead to 54-50, but J.R. Blount hit four free throws and Tracy Robinson converted a tip-in with a second left to send the game into overtime at 56-56. Young opened overtime with a 3-point play and the Ramblers never trailed after that. Torre Johnson led Wisconsin-Milwaukee with 19 points, while Paige Paulsen added 17. Blount had 20 points for Loyola and Robinson added 18.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
